Meteor.Graphics

Class Bitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • Meteor.Graphics.Bitmap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite, Spritesheet

    public class Bitmap
extends java.lang.Object
    Bitmap is a representation of a region of pixel data as derived from a BufferedImage. Assets (images) are loaded in the form of BufferedImage before translated into an array integer representation of its pixel data. The render context then calculates the suitable coordinate on-screen to render the bitmap.

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap(int width,
              int height)
        Creates an empty bitmap of specified size.
        Parameters:
        w - Width of bitmap
        h - Height of bitmap

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap(Bitmap bitmap)
        Creates a deep clone of an existing bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - Source bitmap to be cloned

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Creates a bitmap from a sample BufferedImage. All color data and other properties are then derived from this image.
        Parameters:
        image - Sample BufferedImage.

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap(int[] data,
              int w,
              int h)
        Creates a bitmap from existing color data and given size. The BufferedImage representation will be generated from the color data.
        Parameters:
        data - Color data.
        w - Width of the bitmap.
        h - Height of the bitmap.

        Parameters:
        scale - Scaling ratio.
        Returns:
        The scaled version of this bitmap based on a scaling ratio.

      • getScaled

        public Bitmap getScaled(int width,
                        int height)
        Generates a scaled version of this bitmap based on a new given dimension.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of scaled bitmap.
        height - Height of scaled bitmap.
        Returns:
        The scaled version of this bitmap based on a new given dimension.

      • getData

        public int[] getData(int xStart,
                     int yStart,
                     int xEnd,
                     int yEnd)
        Returns a region of pixels within the bitmap. The parameters define the bounds of the region.
        Parameters:
        xStart - Starting x-coordinate
        yStart - Starting y-coordinate
        xEnd - Ending x-coordinate
        yEnd - Ending y-coordinate
        Returns:
        The integer array of pixels of a given region within the bitmap

      • getFlipped

        public Bitmap getFlipped(boolean horizontal,
                         boolean vertical)
        Creates a transformed bitmap that has been flipping vertically or horizontally. A copy of the pixel data is generated and the original is not affected by this method.
        Parameters:
        horizontal - Flag for flipping horizontally.
        vertical - Flag for flipping vertically.
        Returns:
        A bitmap that is flipped by provided parameters.

      • getRegionAsBitmap

        public Bitmap getRegionAsBitmap(int xStart,
                                int yStart,
                                int xEnd,
                                int yEnd)
        Returns a bitmap that is a smaller portion of the original. This is similar to 'getPixels(int xStart, int yStart, int xEnd, int yEnd)' but the result is wrapped in a Bitmap class for simplified use in RenderContext. The parameters specified define the bounds for the sub-bitmap.
        Parameters:
        xStart - Starting x-coordinate.
        yStart - Starting y-coordinate.
        xEnd - Ending x-coordinate.
        yEnd - Ending y-coordinate.
        Returns:
        A bitmap that is a portion of the original.
        See Also:
        RenderContext.
